intro: Psychotria moroidea, commonly known as the Moroides Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria moroidea is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
